title: About me
text:
On this about page, you might want to add more information about yourself, the project, or course. Any helpful context could go here!
My name is Nick Hand, the instructor for the course. You can find more information about me on my personal website.
This site is an example site showing how to use Quarto for the final project for MUSA 550, during fall 2023.

title: Crime Trends and Socioeconomic Analysis in Philadelphia
text:
In this project, we delve into the intricate relationship between crime trends and socioeconomic factors in Philadelphia. Utilizing advanced analytical techniques, we aim to uncover patterns and insights that can help in understanding and potentially mitigating crime in urban areas.
Our analysis is powered by Quarto, enabling us to integrate Python code seamlessly with our narrative, and our findings are shared online via GitHub Pages. This platform allows us to present a comprehensive and interactive exploration of crime data and socioeconomic variables.






Note



Our project is a culmination of extensive research and data analysis. While this site serves as a primary mode of dissemination, we encourage viewers to explore the data and methodologies in depth for a richer understanding.

Our project is a culmination of extensive research and data analysis. While this site serves as a primary mode of dissemination, we encourage viewers to explore the data and methodologies in depth for a richer understanding.

title: Crime Trends and Socioeconomic Analysis in Philadelphia
text:
Project Overview
Here, we provide a brief overview of our projectâ€™s objectives, the datasets used, and the analytical methods employed.

Objective: Our main goal is to understand how various socioeconomic factors correlate with crime trends in Philadelphia.
Data Sources: We utilize public datasets from the Philadelphia Police Department, U.S. Census data, and other relevant sources.
Methodology: Our approach includes data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling, and spatial analysis using Python.

title: Crime Trends and Socioeconomic Analysis in Philadelphia
text:
In-Depth Analysis
This section dives deep into the specifics of our analysis. We break down our approach into several key components:

Data Preparation and Cleaning: Details on how we processed the raw data.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Initial findings and patterns observed from the data.
Statistical Analysis: Results from various statistical tests and models.
Spatial Analysis: Geographic patterns and insights derived from the data.
